Change log All releases

hesim 0.1.1

New features

  • New general framework for integrating statistical models with economic evaluation. Specifically, building a decision model by specifying a model structure, which consists of a set of statistical models for predicting disease progression, utility values, and costs. Each statistical model, in turn, is used to predict or simulate outcomes as a function of estimated parameters and input data. Available via input_data() and functions prefixed by params.
  • N-state partitioned survival analysis with PartSurv.
  • Sampling parameters of a statistical model fit with R using Monte Carlo methods or bootstrapping with the generic function form_params().
  • Parameter estimates from either an R based model or from an external source. Functions prefixed by form can be used to create classes for economic simulation modeling from statistical models fit with R.
  • Parameter estimates for survival models with flexsurvreg or flexsurvspline from the flexsurv package. Create survival models for simulation modeling from external data with params_surv() and params_surv_list() or from a fitted R based model using form_params(). Support for parametric survival models (exponential, Weibull, Gompertz, gamma, lognormal log-logistic, generalized gamma), splines, or fractional polynomials.
  • Separate partitioned survival models during period of observed data and for extrapolation by using joined().

hesim 0.1.0

The initial CRAN submission.
